column4: Could not start the X server (your graphical environment) due to some internal error. Please contact your system administrator or check your syslog to diagnose. In the meantime this display will be disabled. Please restart GDM when the problem is corrected. "I apreciate any help"
somone knows how to solve this one
i tried to do many things on google
i tried to fix xorg.conf, but it didn't work
i tried sudo dpkg-reconfigure... and dpkg-preconfigure too
i tried many configuration a lot of times
sudo dpkg-reconfigure --phigh xserver-xorg
what means phigh
an option
--phigh just means that the dpkg-reconfigure is set to a high priority instead of a low one
try to look into /etc/X11/xorg.conf, think you'll find some old config files there
i opened this serveral times i looked into this a lot of changed too
i used the dpkg-reconfigure and the -preconfigure
did it happen after you installed video drivers?
I think good desision would be reinstall all system and to be careful next time
i didn't do nothing much different
i new on ubuntu, i reinstalled much times to do it work, i need to learn how to fix it
what kind of video card do you have?
i remembered what i did. i was trying to use my second HD giving it permissions
with nvidias it's easy :)
Could not start the X server was trying to use my second HD giving it permissions when it happened
